articles.title: CDC reverts previous guidance on airborne Covid-19 spread - CNN Video
articles.description: The CDC on Monday abruptly reverted to its previous guidance about how coronavirus is transmitted, removing language about airborne transmission it had posted just days earlier. CNN's Elizabeth Cohen tells us more.
articles.content: Chat with us in Facebook Messenger. Find out what's happening in the world as it unfolds.

articles.title: Coronavirus Australia live update: Victoria reports 28 new Covid cases and NSW two as Queensland relaxes border restrictions

articles.description: Italy's national airline Alitalia is trialing short-haul routes where every passenger has a negative confirmed coronavirus test.
articles.content:

Alitalia is an airline betting that the answer to that question is "yes."

articles.description: The one-day tally of deaths linked to Covid-19 in the US fell to 287 on Monday, the lowest since early September. Global stocks dropped on fears of new coronavirus lockdowns.

articles.author: Nicole Wetsman
articles.title: CDC removes guidance about airborne spread of the coronavirus
articles.description: The CDC posted, and then removed, guidelines saying that the coronavirus can spread by air and that people can catch COVID-19 from six feet away. The reversal could erode trust in the agency, which has already been sidelined during the pandemic.
articles.content:
The agency says it was posted by accident
Photo by Craig F. Walker/The Boston Globe via Getty Images

articles.title: Stocks tumble on worries about Washington gridlock and coronavirus
articles.description: In a painful start to the week for the Dow and the broader market, stocks tumbled Monday as investors worry about when Washington will agree on another stimulus bill.
